column2: `` john adams diary august 29 1774 august 29-september 5 1774 1774 aug. 29. monday rode trenton upon delaware river break fast. williams 's tavern trenton ferry saw four large black walnut trees standing row behind house. 1 seems trees plenty southern provinces -- black walnut timber used cabinet makers boston brought southern provinces. town trenton pretty village -- appears largest town seen jerseys larger elizabeth town brunswick prince town. crossed ferry delaware river province pensylvania. rode across elbow came delaware -- beautifull river navigable far trenton. country side level. arrived bristol eleven clock village delaware opposite burlington. scenes nature delightfull. 20 miles philadelphia. saw two 3 passage waggons -- vehicle four wheels contrived carry many passengers much baggage. rode red lion dined. dinner stopped frankfort frankford five miles town. number carriages gentlemen came phyladelphia meet us. mr. thomas mifflin mr. mckean lower counties one delegates mr. rutledge carolina number gentlemen philadelphia. mr. folsom mr. sullivan n. hampshire delegates. introduced gentlemen cordially wellcomed philadelphia. rode town dirty dusty fatigued could resist importunity go tavern genteel one america. introduced number gentlemen city-dr. shippen dr. knox mr. smith multitude others mr. linch mr. gadsden s. carolina. fresh welcome city philadelphia time spent conversation curtain drawn half chamber supper appeared elegant ever laid upon table. eleven clock retired. computation made evening mr. mckean congress 56 members twenty two lawyers. mr. mckean gave account evening behaviour ruggles former congress 1765. treated pretty cavalierly behaviour dishonourable. gentleman 2 returned town mr. paine coach undertook caution us two gentlemen particu- larly. one dr. smith provost colledge looking government american episcopate pair lawn sleeves. soft polite insinuating adulating sensible learned industrious indefatigable art enough refinement upon art make impressions even mr. dickinson mr. reed. 1774. aug. 30. tuesday. walked little town. visited markett state house carpenters hall congress sit 3 c. -- call 'd mr. mifflins -- grand spacious elegant house. much conversation mr. charles thompson thomson seems marrying lady relation mr. dickensons 5000£. st erling. charles thompson sam. adams phyladelphia -- life cause liberty say. friend collins came see us invited us dine thursday. returned lodgings mr. lynch mr. gadsden mr. middleton young mr. rutledge came visit us. mr. linch introduced mr. middleton us. mr. middleton silent reserved young rutledge high enough. promise king mentioned. started `` regard word. promises worth thing `` c. young smart spirited body. mr. blair came visit us another gentleman. mr. smith old gentleman introduced us son. another mr. smith came mr. paine. regularity elegance city striking. situated upon neck land two miles wide river delaware river schuilkill. streets exactly straight parrallell river. front street near river 2 street 3d 4th 5th 6th 7th 8th 9th. cross streets intersect equally wide straight parallell named forrest fruit trees pear street apple street walnut street chestnut street c. towards evening mr. thomas smith son old gentleman made us visit brother mr. smith minister casco bay dr. shippen brother mr. reed went us hospital. saw lower rooms ground cells lunaticks number furious merry melancholly among rest john ingham saved taunton court whipped sold horse stealing. went sick rooms long large walks rows beds side lame sick upon -- dreadfull scene human wretchedness. weakness languor distress misery objects truely woefull sight. dr. shippen carried us chamber shewed us series anatomical paintings exquisite art. great variety views human body whole parts. dr. entertained us clear concise comprehensive lecture parts human frame. entertainment charmed. first shewed us set paintings bodies entire alive -- others skin taken first coat muscles taken second -- bare bones. shewed us paintings insides man seen muscles belly taken. heart lungs stomach gutts. 1774 aug. 31. wednesday. breakfasted mr. bayards philadelphia mr. sprout presbyterian minister. made visit governor ward rhode island lodgings. introduced several gentlemen. mr. dickenson farmer pensylvania came mr. wards lodgings see us coach four beautifull horses. introduced us politely said exceedingly glad pleasure seeing gentlemen made enquiry health brother sister boston. gave us account late ill health present gout. first time getting. mr. dickenson subject hectic complaints. shadow -- tall slender reed -- pale ashes. one would think first sight could live month. yet upon attentive inspection looks springs life strong enough last many years. dined mr. lynch lady daughter lodgings mrs. mckenzies. agreable dinner afternoon notwithstanding violent heat. vastly pleased mr. lynch. solid firm judicious man. told us coll. washington made eloquent speech virginia convention ever made. says `` raise 1000 men subsist expence march self head relief boston.\ `` 4 entertained us scandalous history sir egerton leigh story wifes sister dodging uncle story girl swore lord mayor. says lynch greater rascall among kings friends. great merit reign. mr. lynch says shall export year 12,000 wt. indigo 150,000 tierces rice s. carolina. 300 ships employed. mrs. lynch enquired kindly mrs. adams 's health mrs. smith family mr. boylstone mrs. mr. gill c. august 29 1774 1774 septr. 1. thursday. day breakfasted mr. mifflins mr. c. thompson came soon dr. smith. fa mous dr. smith provost colledge. appears plain man -- tall rather aukward -- appearance art. went return visits gentlemen visited us. visited mr. cadwallader gentleman large fortune grand elegant house furniture. visited mr. powell another splendid seat. visited gentlemen s. carolina twelve introduced mr. galloway speaker house pensylvania. looks like ben. davis sandimanian. dined friend collins 's -- stephen collins 's -- govr. hopkins govr. ward mr. galloway mr. rhoades c. evening gentlemen congress arrived town met smiths new city tavern spent evening together. 25 members come. virginia n. carolina maryland city n. york arrived. mr. william livingston jerseys lately new york. plain man tall black wears hair -- nothing elegant genteel. say public speaker sensible learned ready writer. mr. rutledge elder appearance promising. keenness eye. depth countenance. nothing profound sagacious brilliant sparkling first appearance. yesterday removed lodgings house miss jane port arch street half way front street second street. find tribe people exactly like tribe massachusetts hutchinsonian addressers. indeed sett every colony. seen revolutions senti- ments. opinions undergone many changes moon. time stamp act professed parliamentary claim right tax americans friends constitutions charter c. bernard privately secretly endeavouring procure alteration charter. concealed designs untill letters detected. hutchinson professed stanch friend liberty charter untill letters detected -- great number good people thought good man sincere friend congregational interest religion charter priviledges. went machiavilian dissimulation untill letters detected -- waited untill boston port bill passed thinking people must submit immediately lord north would carry whole system triumphantly threw mask. dr. smith mr. galloway mr. vaughan others town hutchinsonian faction year 1764 1765 endeavouring obtain repeal stamp act. 1774. fryday. septr. 2. dined mr. thom. mifflins mr. lynch mr.middleton two rutledges ladies. two rutledges good lawyers. govr. hopkins govr. ward company. mr. lynch gave us sentiment `` brave dantzickels declare free face greatest monarch europe.\ `` sociable happy. coffee went tavern introduced peyton randolph esqr speaker virginia coll. harrison richard henry lee esq coll. bland. randolph large well looking man. lee tall spare man. bland learned bookish man. gentlemen virginia appear spirited consistent. harrison said would come foot rather come. bland said would gone upon occasion jericho. 1774. saturday. septr. 3. breakfasted dr. shippens. dr. witherspoon. coll. r. h. lee lodges. masterly man. mr. lee brother sherriff london 5 dr.arthur lee mrs. shippen. sensible deep thinkers. lee making repeal every revenue law boston port bill bill altering massachusetts constitution quebec bill removal troops end congress abstinence dutied articles means -- rum mollosses sugar tea wine fruits c. absolutely certain ship carries home resolution bring back redress. suppose time would intervene exceptions. thinks inform majesty never happy lords bute mansfield north confidents councillors. took pen attempted calculation numbers people represented congress made 2200000 revenue actually raised made 80,000£ st. would allow ld. north great abilities. seen symptoms. whole administration blunder. said opposition feeble incompetent hitherto time make vigorous exertions. mrs. shippen religious reasoning lady. said often thought people boston could behaved tryals much prudence firmness time influenced superiour power. mr.lee think 's strike navigation acts would unite every man britain us kingdom could exist without advantages derive regulations restrictions trade ample compensation protection afforded us afford us. dr. witherspoon enters great spirit american cause. seems hearty friend natives -- animated son liberty. forenoon mr. caesar rodney lower counties delaware river two mr. tilghmans maryland introduced us. went mr. wm. barrell store drank punch eat dryed smoaked sprats read papers letters boston. dined mr. joseph reed lawyer mrs. deberdt mrs. reed mr. willing mr. thom. smith mr. de hart c. spent evening mr. mifflins lee harrison virginia two rutledges dr. witherspoon dr. shippen dr. steptoe another gentleman. elegant supper drank sentiments till 11 clock. lee harrison high. lee dined mr. dickenson drank burgundy whole afternoon. harrison gave us sentiment `` constitutional death lords bute mansfield north.\ `` paine gave us `` may collision british flint american steel produce spark liberty shall illumine latest posterity.\ `` wisdom britain firmness colonies may britain wise america free. friends america throughout world. union colonies. unanimity congress. may result congress answer expectations people. union britain colonies constitutional foundation -- many toasts. young rutledge told studied 3 years temple. thinks great distinction. says took volume notes j. quincy transcribed. says young gentlemen ought travel early freedom ease behaviour necessary acquired early life. rutledge young -- sprightly deep. indistinct inarticulate way speaking. speaks nose -- wretched speaker conversation. shine public dont yet know. seems good natured tho conceited. lady bad health. brother still maintains air reserve design cunning -- like duane galloway bob auchmuty. caesar rodney oddest looking man world. tall -- thin slender reed -- pale -- face bigger large apple. yet sense fire spirit wit humour countenance. made merry ruggles pretended scruples timidities last congress. mr. reed told us dinner never saw greater joy saw london news arrived nonimportation agreement broke. universally shaking hands congratulating. says george haley worst enemy america knew -- swore would stand government measures allways censuring cursing america. 1774. septr. 4. sunday. went presbyterian meeting heard mr.sprout forenoon. uses notes -- dont appear. opens bible talks away. numerous polite assembly. dined lodgings mrs. yards major de boor french gentleman soldier mr. webb another. went afternoon christ church heard mr. coombs. noble building genteeler congregation. organ new choir singers musical. mr. coombs celebrated fine speaker. sprightly great deal action speaks distinctly. confess charmed oratory. style indifferent method confused. one word composition vastly inferiour ordinary sermons hunt chauncy cooper elliot even stillman. mr. mifflin spent sunday evening us lodgings. 1774. .septr. 5. monday. ten delegates met city tavern 6 walked carpenters hall took view room chamber excellent library. also long entry gentlemen may walk convenient chamber opposite library. general cry good room question put whether satisfyed room passed affirmative. negative chiefly pensylvania new york. 7 mr. lynch arose said gentleman present presided great dignity respectable society greatly advantage america therefore proposed hon. peytoun randolph esqr one delegates virginia late speaker house burgesses appointed chairman doubted would unanimous. question put unanimously chosen. mr. randolph took chair commissions delegates produced read. mr. lynch proposed mr. charles thompson gentleman family fortune character city appointed secretary accordingly done without opposition tho mr. duane mr. jay discovered first inclination seek. 8 mr. duane moved committee appointed prepare regulations congress. several gentlemen objected. arose asked leave president request gentleman new york explanation would point particularly method voting whether colonies poll interests. mr. henry arose said first general congress ever happened -- former congress could precedent -- occasion general congresses therefore precedent ought established. would great injustice little colony weight councils america great one therefore committee. major sullivan observed little colony stake well great one. question great importance. vote colonies method liable great inequality injustice 5 small colonies 100,000 people may outvote 4 large ones 500,000 inhabitants. vote poll colonies proportion members others less. vote interests attended insuperable difficulties ascertain true importance colony. weight colony ascertained number inhabitants merely -- amount trade quantity exports imports compound ratio. lead us field controversy greatly perplex us. besides question whether possible ascertain time numbers people value trade. case take 's words. ought ascertained authentic evidence records. 9 ``

`` robert treat paine 's diary august 29-september 5 1774 august 29. set early rode thro trenton ferry. 12 a.m. breakfasted williams tavern. cross 'd ferry del ware rode bristol 8 miles thence red lyon tavern 7 miles august 30 1774 din 'd. exceeding sultry ther mometer 90°. thence frankfort met. friends philadelphia rode city dusk. conducted friends city tavern 2d street kept smith. elegant supper thence went mr. sarah yeards lodged. august 30. foggy morning broke scalding hot. a.m. walked mr. mifflin al see state house c. p.m. conducted dr william shippen hospital. among lunaticks cells saw john ingham. august 31. hot. breakfasted mr. j ohn bayard. visited mr. stephen collins. dind thomas lynch one delegates. carolina. removed lodging mrs. jane port arch street. month hot. september 1. exceeding hot sultry. breakfasted mr. thos. mifflin. spent a.m. returning many visits ceremony gentlemen visited us. dind mr. stephen collins. p.m. walk 'd visited. 6 oclock members congress town met city tavern adjourned monday next. evening sunset thunderstorm. rained hard evening night. september 2. fine fair day. dined mr. thos. mifflin. .september 3. raind hard last night coold air. dined mr. joseph reed 's. p.m. moved lodgings back mrs sarah yard fore street. supd mr. mifflin 's. september 4. cloudy. a.m. heard mr. sprout meeting presbyterian. p.m. heard mr. combs christ church. dind lodgings september 5. raind hard last night. cool morning. delegates colonies except carolina arrived town met city tavern 10 clock thence went view room call 'd carpenters hall offered congress sit members approving agreed meet. chose honable peyton randolph esqr. president mr. charles thompson secretary read returns qualifications members adjourned morrow 10 oclock. p.m. wrote dr. cobb send ``

`` samuel ward 's diary august 30-september 5 1774 arrived philadelphia 30th. augst. 1774 evening. augst. 31st. forenoon delegates. carolina august 30 1774 gentlen. city came see soon delegates boston newhampshire city save town farmer john dickinson. 1 afternoon several gents. city mr. hopkins lady delegates connecticut arrived sepr. 1st. delegates n. jersies two province n york arrived conversed many delegates evening meeting new. tavern took list present twenty five. september 2nd. four delegates virginia one lower counties arrived. met evening. bells rang. september 3rd. delegates maryland arrived frequent conversations. september 4th. delegates virginia. 2 september 5th. met new. tavern went carp. hall liking place agreed hold congress took list delegates chose honble payton randolph esqr. president mr. charles thompson secry read appointments delegates considered manner colony 's voting rules regulating business adjourned 10 o'clock morrow ``

`` caesar rodney thomas rodney sir 1 philadelphia sepr. 9th 1774 thursday 1st month verry warm disagreable ride arrived town together virginia gentlemen. sunday evening last delegates different colonies except north carolina georgia came town munday met carpenters hall. hon. peyton september 9 1774 randolph unanimously elected chair name president. charles thompson chose secretary two door keepers mesengers also appointed. congress pro ceeded business set every day since. doubt rising time october. perhaps middle. seven del- egates appointed virginia sensible fine fellows 'd never wish see short greatest assembly pro portion number ever collected america. bostonians know condemned many violence moderate men compared virginia south carolina rode island. short colonies seem hearty cause greatest respect paid first people. letter mr. cushing express boston informs quiet yet superior court met act parliament altering government could proceed want jury men would attend allmost judges appointed act waited governor resignations. 2 captain inglis arrived dry goods london george emlens ship expected every day quite full accot. sailing fortner also expected soon. verry poorly ever since came town hope shall get better. remember betsey. sally caesar enquiring friends congress meets nine therefore time say yr. humble servt. caesar rodney ``

`` samuel ward samuel ward jr. dear children philadelphia 9th sepr. 1774 divine goodness well. cajoe complaints yesterday like small pox much better day think cold fatigue. far judge little danger taking. congress full excepting gentlemen north carolina. chose honble payton randolp esqr. virginia president mr. charles thompson town secry. agreed colony one voice every question. warmly debated larger colonies wanted larger number voices. agreed upon honor discover proceed- ings determined make public. must therefore expect nothing head. unanimous expected. much largest part province hearty cause liberty. southern gentlemen used business afternoon rise 2 3 o'clock set day meet late morning shall sett long. dont doubt business. careful shop charge every thing unpaid. hardly think shall want much money need uneasy acct. orchard ought carefully shut may save apples try buy cyder none road. time fat cattle island. september 9 1774 fed potatoes. hogs also ought potatoes plentifully every day. pleasure seeing mr. davis day. gone preach country call upon comes back fear shall able go home. say shall endeavour duty soon well return soon possible. daily prayers hope pray. dear sister 1 alive may god infinite goodness still support comfort carry chearfully great change. affectionate regards aunt. hope stay till return. lord may bless ardent prayer affect. father. ward ``

`` john adams diary 1774 septr. 10. saturday. attended duty upon sub committee. 1 dined home. dr. morgan dr. cocks cox. mr. spence spencer. several gentlemen major sullivan coll. folsom dined us upon salt fish. rambled evening jo. reed fell mr. sprouts meeting heard mr. spence preach. mr. reed returned mr. adams lodgings social agreable communicative evening. says never guilty masterly stroke policy moving mr. duchè might read prayers good effect c. says sentiments people growing favourable every day ``

`` john adams diary 1774. septr. 11. sunday. quick constant succession new scenes characters persons events turning cant keep regular account. mr. reed sensible accomplished lawyer amiable disposition -- soft tender friendly c. friend country liberty. mr. reed kind wait us mr. sprouts meeting heard mr. spencer. ministers preach without notes. opportunity seeing custom presbyterians administering sacrament. communicants came row seats placed side narrow table spread middle alley reaching deacons seat front house. three setts persons sexes came succession. new sett bread cup given new minister -- mr. sprout first mr. treat next mr. spencer last. communicant token delivers deacons elders dont know call em. came meeting mr. webster join 'd us come boston generous benefactor distresses. says town meeting thinks managed affairs great symplicity moderation discretion. 1 september 11 1774 dined mr. willings judge supream court gentlemen virgina maryland new york. splendid feast -- turtle every thing else. mr. willing told us story lawyer day gave upon bench following answer question lawyers increased. `` ask lawyers much increas 'd tho country already fleec 'd reason 'm sure strikingly plain sheep oft sheered yet wool grows tho may think e'er odd matter oft'ner 're fleeced wool grows better thus downy-chin 'd boys oft heard frequently shaving obtain large beard.\ `` mr. peters written bar given judge mr. willing asked question dinner pleasantry. mr. willing sociable agreable man. told us law place whereas oysters months may septr. found unwholesome food brought markett forfeited given poor. drank coffee reed cushing strolled moravian evening lecture heard soft sweet music dutchified english prayer preachment ``

`` silas deane elizabeth deane september 12-18 1774 monday. day usual spent committees. tuesday dined mr. smith merchant city -- wednesday thursday attended business. friday grand entertainment state house. sammy webb must describe. five hundred gentlemen sat say plenty everything eatable drinkable scarcity good humor diversion. besides delegates gentlemen every province continent present. 1 saturday. send resolves day applauded skies inhabitants city say nothing. 2 shall return uncertain first entering city. arm patience determine desert cause. hope health returns. j webb says rather see hand. mr. revere sets morning early send letter brings sunday evening heard mr. deshay morning highland parson imported last week mountains north scotland noon. saw wm. goddard looks dejected thought much choose seen public. certainly engaged two potent adversaries differed galloway wharton. 3 affectionate regards families neighborhood. dear affectionate husband 4 silas deane ``

`` john adams diary 1774. sept. 14. wednesday. visited mr. gadsden mr. deane coll. dyer c. lodgings. gadsden violent allowing parliament power regulating trade allowing thing us. power regulating trade says power ruining us -- bad acknowledging supream legislative cases september 14 1774 whatsoever. right regulating trade right legislation right legislation one case right. deny. attended congress committee forenoon. dined dr. cox. dr. morgan dr. rush mr. bayard old mr. smith dined us. dr. rush lives upon water street windows back room chamber fine prospect delaware river new jersey beyond. gentlemen entertained us absurdities laws pensylvania new jersey maryland. find genteel topic conversation. mighty feast nothing less best claret madeira burgundy. melons fine beyond description pears peaches excellent. day mr. chase introduced us mr. carrell carroll anapolis sensible gentleman roman catholic first fortune america. 1 income ten thousand pounds sterling year fourteen two 3 years say besides father vast estate father ``

`` john adams abigail adams dear phyladelphia septr. 14. 1774 written since left 1 imputed variety causes explain want time. would fill volumes give exact idea whole tour. time totally filled moment get bed untill return. visits ceremonies company business news papers pamphlets c. c. c. congress present appearance well united measures hope give satisfaction friends country. tory despicable animal creation. spi- september 14 1774 ders toads snakes proper emblems. massachu- setts councillors addressers held curious esteem see. spirit firmness prudence province vastly applauded universally acknowledged saviours defenders american liberty. designs plans congress must communicated untill compleated shall move great deliberation. shall come home know present dont expect take leave city four weeks. compliments love service due. babes never mind absent heart. adieu. john adams ``

`` john adams william tudor friend phyladelphia septr. 14. 1774 totally taken dont know whether acknowledged agreable letters. 1 use well amusement assure. hardly conceive avidity letter mr trumbulls indeed every scrap letter newspaper boston read. conceive esteem honour mass. held. write gentlemen delegates around reading news papers. hear around praising admiring. god g-d says one dont believe people world -- another answers really dont think fine people upon globe -- cool cautious prudent yet unalterably determined. dear friend pray write every opportunity. dont wait returns. much business -- much plea sure -- much ceremony much trifling time write line. yet give remembrancer. congress well united -- secret yet. shall lo tolerably well. choice collection north america afford an- swer. adieu john adams september 14 1774 p.s. thank mr williams mr hill mr trumble letters pray continue ``

`` samuel adams boston committee correspondence gentlemen philada. sept 14 1774 waiting great impatience letter committee correspondence town boston upon whose wisdom judgment much rely. 1 congress resolved committees sub committees seem fully sensible intollerable grievances colonies struggling determined procure effectual redress. subject matter debates restraind upon honor disclosing present may assure sentiments congress hitherto discovered business assignd several committees perfectly coincide expectations. spirit countrymen great honor. brethren county middlesex resolved nobly resolutions read several members body high applause. 2 generally agreed opposition new mode government ought maintained. warm advocate cause liberty america much obligd former labors told fully opinion officer new estab- lishment ought acknowledgd hand warned exercising authority upon pain utmost resentment people. therefore greatly satisfaction observe measures taken. pleasd hear provincial congress proposd promise self firm manly perservering opposition single province opperate total frustration villanous designs tyrants distruction. hope committee continue act dignity importance. yet opinion heaven honor great share merit saving rights america. may god inspire wisdom fortitude. must beg ex- september 14 1774 cuse hasty effusion honest heart committee informed vessell immediately sail marblehead. pray let hear committee. know man fortune need fear putting expence postage -- direct mr saml smith sons merchts city. conclude warmest prayers supreme salvation country. friend fellow countryman fellow labourer samuel adams ``

`` john adams abigail adams phyladelphia septr. 16. 1774 leisure moment congress assembling gladly embrace write line. congress first met mr. cushing made motion opened prayer. opposed mr. jay n. york mr. rutledge south carolina divided religious sentiments episcopalians quakers anabaptists presbyterians congregationalists could join act worship. mr. s. adams arose said bigot could hear prayer gentleman piety virtue time friend country. stranger phyladelphia heard mr. duchè dushay pronounce deserved character therefore moved mr. duchè episcopal clergyman might desired read prayers congress tomorrow morning motion seconded passed affirmative. mr. randolph president waited mr. duchè received answer health would permit certainly would. accordingly next morning appeared clerk pontificallibus read several prayers established form read collect seventh clay september thirty fifth psalm. must remember next morning heard horrible rumour cannonade boston. never saw greater effect upon audience. seemed heaven ordained psalm read morning. mr. duchè unexpected every body struck extemporary prayer filled bosom every man pre sent. must confess never heard better prayer one well pronounced. episcopalian dr. cooper never prayed fervour ardor earnestness pathos language elegant sublime -- america congress. province massachusetts bay especially town boston. excellent effect upon every body. must beg read psalm. faith sortes virgilianae sortes homericae especially sortes biblicae would thought providential. amuse friends read letter 35th. psalm. read father mr. wibirt. wonder braintree churchmen would think. mr. duchè one ingenious men best characters greatest orators episcopal order upon continent -- yet zealous friend liberty country. 1 september 17 1774 long see dear family. god bless preserve prosper. adieu. john adams ``

`` john adams abigail adams dear phyladelphia septr. 18. 1774 received agreable letter mr. marston received two others gave much pleasure. wrote several letters whether reached know. much rascallity management letters come fashion determined write nothing consequence even friend bosom conveyances sure. proceedings congress profound secret yet except two votes passed yesterday ordered printed. see every quarter. votes passed full congress perfect unanimity. esteem affection admiration people boston massachusetts expressed yesterday fixed determination supported enough melt heart stone. saw tears gush eyes old grave pacific quakers pensylvania. conceive dear harry business visits ceremonies obliged go. delicate course steer much activity much insensibility critical interested situation. flatter however shall conduct embassy manner merit approbation country. taken us much time get acquainted tempers views characters designs persons let circumstances province. dear intreat every friend ave write. every line comes friends greedily enquired letters done us vast service. middlesex suffolk acquired unbounded honour. idea submission bodies head. september 18 1774 thank dear nabby letter -- tell given great spirits. kiss sweet ones. adieu. john adams ``
